hook.text: Inception, The Matrix, Nightmare on Elm Street. Cinema is obsessed with the blurry line between sleep and waking.

buildup.text: Films use sleep as a gateway to alternate realities, exploring consciousness, identity, and control.

discovery.text: Inception's nested dream levels mirror real sleep architecture, with deeper levels harder to reach and escape.

twist.text: Horror films exploit sleep paralysis imagery, the old hag, the demon on the chest, drawn from real experiences.

climax.text: Film has shaped public understanding of sleep more than science has, for better and worse.

punchline.text: Hollywood makes sleep fascinating. Real sleep science struggles to compete.

quiz.question: What real sleep phenomenon do many horror films draw from?
